Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2009 10:00AM JulieS wrote: Just celebrating my sixth anniversary this month! Multifocal cancer, 5 out of 13 nodes with extra capsular extension and perineural invasion. I feel FABULOUS! My onc told me "we are going for a cure--you are fit and strong." I was 65 and there were times during treatment when I felt I might not be as strong and fit as he thought I was. I made it through TAC--6 treatments 3 weeks apart, 30 rads and 5 years of Arimidex. The first 6 months were horrible, the next 3 were O.K., the last 5 years have been the best of my life. Hunker down, do whatever it takes and enjoy the rest of your life which will probably be a long one.
Posts.Title: Help. So scared! merryheart AnacortesGirl

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2008 01:08PM JulieS wrote: I am four years and six months into my five years--finish in June. The side effects lessened as time went on. Could hardly move in the morning at first and didn't sleep. No longer have the joint paint but still have some difficulty sleeping. I exercise a lot in hopes of being tired and keeping my bones healthy. I am curious to see if there are differences when I go off Arimidex but am half hoping my onc decides to keep me on indefinitely. He says there are a lot of studies in place to determine if long-term use is better. I feel a little scared to think that I won't be doing anything to ward off a recurrence. JulieS
